results.title: Color her sunshine
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television, WCET and Doris Lawrence
results.brief_description: The story of Mary who was born with Down’s syndrome. Down’s syndrome children respond to individual love and attention, and are capable of taking care of themselves as they grow into adulthood. Mary is seen doing simple tasks in a sheltered workshop and participating in recreational activities.

results.title: Color categorising behaviour of rhesus monkeys
results.brief_description: This psychological study is part of a research project on brain disorders. For over a year, adult male and female Rhesus monkeys and a baby monkey were trained and taught to sort various objects according to their size, color and shape. Such experiments and their results are of primary interest to psychology students.

results.title: Color and pigment in art
results.brief_description: Demonstrates by use of a glass prism that white light is actually a combination of several colors, which can be reproduced by pigments. Shows how the three primary colors can be mixed to make secondary colors and, in turn, intermediate colors. A color solid shows the three dimensions of color - hue, value and intensity, and examples illustrate how combinations of colors can create pleasing effects and different moods and feelings.

results.title: Color and light: an introduction
results.brief_description: Demonstrates characteristics of colour formation by different kinds of light. Uses theatrical spotlights to show the effect of various kinds of light with opaque, transparent, and translucent objects.

results.title: Color (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Illustrates color in nature - in pigments, yarn, clay, wood, and other art materials in order to stimulate interest in experimentation and encourage children to put colors together in their own way.

results.title: Color
results.creator_credit: Coast Community Colleges, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.), CBS, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Sandra Ostertag
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explores the reasons for the “colour revolution” in fine art photography which occurred in the last ten years. Kenda North demonstrates her simplified version of the dye transfer colour process and discusses the way colour affects the aesthetics, dimensionality and emotional content of a photograph.

results.title: Colonialism: ogre or angel?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
How the British colonial empire grew is a story as full of adventure as it is of contrast. This film takes us to British colonies, protectorates and protected states to see the impact of industrialization on colonial people, and their awakening desire for self-determination. Narrated by Edgar McInnis.

results.title: Colonial Williamsburg
results.brief_description: Williamsburg - for 80 years the capital of England’s Virginia colony - has been restored to its former appearance and today is the only city in America that actually portrays it colonial heritage in its proper setting. Visitors may see how is actually was in the 17th century.
results.description: Williamsburg - for 80 years the capital of England’s Virginia colony - has been restored to its former appearance and today is the only city in America that actually portrays it colonial heritage in its proper setting. Visitors may see how is actually was in the 17th century.

results.title: Colonial expansion of European Nations
results.brief_description: Explains how mercantilism influenced the colonial expansion of European nations in the 16th and 17th centuries. Traces the overseas expansion of Portugal, Spain, England, France and Holland. Discusses the different factors which caused Europeans to leave their homes to settle in North America and in other foreign lands.
